required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Vitamin D Levels And Myoma Uteri
clinical_study.official_title: Vitamin D Levels İn Women With and Without Myoma Uteri

lead_sponsor.agency: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research Hospital

clinical_study.source: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: Women with at least one uterine leiomyoma and polycystic ovary syndrome over 10 mm and women with normal ultrasonographic findings were included in the study. Blood samples were taken for biochemical analysis such as vitamin D, calcium, magnesium, phosphorus, thyroid stimulating hormone (TSH), hemoglobin (hb), hematocrit (htc), platelet (plt), and albumin. The study groups were compared in terms of these biochemical markers and family history of patients, daily sunshine hours, clothing preferences and education level.

primary_outcome.description: Vitamin D levels in blood test

study_pop.textblock: The reproductive age women (25-50 years) with at least one 10 mm or larger diameter leiomyoma detected by transvaginal ultrasound were the study group.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria: The reproductive age women (25-50 years) with at least one 10 mm or larger diameter leiomyoma detected by transvaginal ultrasound were the study group.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with a history of myomectomy,
- chronic systemic disease
- malignancy
- history of adenomyosis
- women in menopause
- pregnant women
- vitamin D supplementation
- lactation
- abortion and pregnancy loss in the last 6 months
- oral contraceptive / hormonal agents in the last 3 months

eligibility.gender_description: 25-50 years old women with and without myoma uteri

facility.name: Kanuni Sultan Süleyman Training and Research Hospital

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research Hospital
responsible_party.investigator_title: pınar kadiroğulları M.D, Department of Obstetrics and Gynecology
